Class ClickState

  • java.lang.Object
    • ClickState
  • public class ClickState
extends java.lang.Object
    Keeps track of the index of clicks on the board. Checks if a click is either on the board or on the active player's hand and converts the coordinates accordingly.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Keagen Thomson

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      (package private) int tileSize
      Based on the pixel width of the cards, used to calculate the index a click is in.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ClickState()
      Constructor for objects of class ClickState

      int getBoardIndex()
      Getter for the board index clicked on
      int getHandIndex()
      Getter for that hand index clicked on
      boolean getHasBoardIndex()
      Checks whether or not a spot on the board has been clicked yet and returns the boolean value
      boolean getHasHandIndex()
      Checks whether or not a card in the hand has been clicked yet and returns the boolean value
      boolean getLastClickedOnBoard()
      Getter for whether or not the 3x3 board was the last thing to be clicked

      Getter for the boolean attribute playPossible

      Calculates if a new click is valid for the current turn player or if it is a click to the board.
      void playMade()
      Sets the state of the clicked locations to false in preparation of a different player using the object to make a play.

      Setter for the board index if clicked on the board.

      Setter for last clicked on state Set to false when setHandIndex is called

      Checks if a spot on the board has been clicked and a card in hand has been clicked, then functions as a setter method for the playPossible attribute.

    • Field Detail

      • tileSize

        int tileSize
        Based on the pixel width of the cards, used to calculate the index a click is in.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClickState

        public ClickState()
        Constructor for objects of class ClickState

    • Method Detail

      • handleNewClick

        public boolean handleNewClick​(Player activePlayer,
                              java.awt.Point p)
        Calculates if a new click is valid for the current turn player or if it is a click to the board. Sets the respective types of clicks and returns if a play is possible after the new click.

      • getHandIndex

        public int getHandIndex()
        Getter for that hand index clicked on
        Returns:
        The index of the last card clicked in the player's hand

      • getBoardIndex

        public int getBoardIndex()
        Getter for the board index clicked on
        Returns:
        The index of the last clicked spot on the board by the current player

      • getLastClickedOnBoard

        public boolean getLastClickedOnBoard()
        Getter for whether or not the 3x3 board was the last thing to be clicked
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if board was last clicked. False if hand was clicked prior.

      • setLastClickedOnBoard

        public void setLastClickedOnBoard​(boolean state)
        Setter for last clicked on state Set to false when setHandIndex is called

      • setBoardIndex

        public void setBoardIndex​(int boardIndex)
        Setter for the board index if clicked on the board. Confirms that the object has a boardIndex;

      • getHasBoardIndex

        public boolean getHasBoardIndex()
        Checks whether or not a spot on the board has been clicked yet and returns the boolean value
        Returns:
        True if a spot on the 3x3 board has been clicked

      • getHasHandIndex

        public boolean getHasHandIndex()
        Checks whether or not a card in the hand has been clicked yet and returns the boolean value
        Returns:
        True if the turn player has clicked their card.

      • updatePlayPossible

        public void updatePlayPossible()
        Checks if a spot on the board has been clicked and a card in hand has been clicked, then functions as a setter method for the playPossible attribute. Sets to True if this object knows that a card has been clicked and a board index has been clicked

      • getPlayPossible

        public boolean getPlayPossible()
        Getter for the boolean attribute playPossible
        Returns:
        True if it is possible to make a play with this object's index attributes

      • playMade

        public void playMade()
        Sets the state of the clicked locations to false in preparation of a different player using the object to make a play. This is so a play attempt won't be made with the last hand index clicked if the next turn player clicks the board first.
